title: Iowa star Caitlin Clark to play in Pro-Am alongside PGA's Zach Johnson

title: Biden says artificial intelligence scientists worried about tech overtaking human thinking and planning

title: 'The View' alienates a fan: Longtime watcher pans show as Biden fan service in blistering NY Times essay
description: In a New York Times guest essay, a longtime fan of "The View" trashed the show as a "chorus of conformity" where the co-hosts push the same viewpoint on various topics.

title: New Mexico police reveal Beau Wilson’s arsenal during deadly May shooting rampage
description: The Farmington Police Department is revealing the arsenal it found in Beau Wilson’s possession following a shooting spree on May 15 in New Mexico.

title: Heat’s Bam Adebayo avoids officiating question on free-throw discrepancy: ‘Will you take the fine?’
description: Miami Heat center Bam Adebayo was asked about the free-throw disparity in Game 1 of the NBA Finals, and the two-time All-Star made sure he wouldn't be fined with his answer.

title: Search for missing children after jungle plane crash intensifies thanks to new evidence
description: The four children have been missing for a month but searchers have found discarded items in that time that give authorities and officials hope that the four are still alive.

title: Republicans condemn New York for sheltering illegal aliens in public schools
description: House Republicans proposed a resolution condemning New York's decision to house illegal immigrants in public school gyms, which has prompted outrage among parents.

title: Mistrial declared for 2 Maryland doctors charged with conspiring to provide Russia with medical records
description: A case has been declared a mistrial after the jury deadlocked on two Maryland doctors accused of trying to help Russia in its war with Ukraine by conspiring to pass medical records.

title: Teens tried to stop Cameron Robbins before he jumped off Bahamas cruise, passenger's parent says
description: Several students tried to stop Cameron Robbins before the recent Louisiana high school graduate jumped off a Bahamas cruise last week, Fox News Digital learned.

title: Pence will face no charges from DOJ, FBI investigation into retention of classified records
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence will not be charged in the Justice Department’s investigation into his alleged improper retention of classified records from his time in the Trump administration, Fox News has learned.

title: Alabama lawmakers give final approval to allow stiffer punishments for those involved in organized crime
description: The Alabama Legislature has approved a bill that could lead to longer prison sentences for felonies tied to organized crime and street gangs. The bill now heads to Gov. Kay Ivey.

title: Biden admin issues 20-year oil drilling ban near Indigenous site, ignoring pleas from Native Americans
description: The Biden administration finalized actions banning new oil and gas leasing for two decades near a historical site despite pleas from a local Native American tribe.

title: US authorities expand slots on app for asylum seekers near Mexican border for second time in less than a month
description: Authorities expanded slots on the mobile app that helps asylum seekers near the Mexican border. This is the second expansion in less than a month.

title: Lawmakers sound off on Target woke controversy: 'Obsession with focusing on children'
description: Capitol Hill lawmakers react to the controversy over Target's Pride collection and decision to move some LGBT apparel following consumer outrage.

title: Tropical Storm Mawar triggers floods, mudslides in Japan as rain intensifies
description: Tropical Storm Mawar brought heavy rains to Japan, on June 2, 2023. The storm has led to mudslides and floods in the country's central and western regions.

title: California nurse's Costa Rica 'trip of lifetime' nearly turns deadly when falling branch causes spine injury
description: California nurse Deanne Niedzela has suffered spinal injuries after being hit by a falling tree branch during a once-in-a-lifetime vacation in Costa Rica.

title: San Jose, Milpitas carjacking and stabbing spree leaves 3 dead, 3 injured in California
description: Police in California’s Bay Area are investigating a carjacking and stabbing spree that left at least three people dead and three others injured.

title: Liz Cheney won't rule out 2024 presidential bid
description: Liz Cheney said in an interview that she has not ruled out running for president, saying that she was focused on defeating former President Donald Trump.

title: Tim Scott's America, Hollywood's men, and more from Fox News Opinion
description: Read the latest from Fox News Opinion & watch videos from Sean Hannity, Raymond Arroyo & more.

title: 'People need hope': Franklin Graham preaches in Seoul on 50th anniversary of father's 1973 Korea crusade
description: Rev. Franklin Graham of the Billy Graham Evangelistic Association is preaching this weekend in Seoul, South Korea, 50 years after his father held a major faith crusade there. He shared thoughts.

title: Ohio abortion question will appear as single issue on fall ballot, a blow to abortion opponents in the state
description: The abortion question will appear as a single issue on Ohio's fall ballot. Abortion opponents wanted the issue to be split: one about abortion, and one about other reproductive care.

title: New York senior citizen charged in mugger's shooting death had warned local newspaper of rising crime
description: A New York man facing weapons charges after allegedly shooting a man who tried to rob him had warned a newspaper that crime was ruining his neighborhood.

title: Alabama lawmakers approve amended proposal to exempt only a portion of overtime pay from income taxes
description: Alabama lawmakers unanimously approved an amended proposal to exempt only a portion of overtime pay from income taxes in a move that would allow workers to retain more of their pay.

title: Watch Air Force cadets react after Biden fell right in front of them
description: Air Force cadets appeared shocked and concerned as President Biden took a hard fall during the Air Force commencement ceremony Thursday.

title: Teen killed, 4 others wounded in exchange of gunfire on Chicago's South Side
description: Two groups exchanged gunfire on the South Side of Chicago, leading to the death of a 14-year-old boy. Four others were wounded in the shooting.

title: Wisconsin Republican lawmakers reject funding for UW-Madison engineering building
description: Funding for an engineering building at the University of Wisconsin-Madison's flagship campus was rejected by Republican state lawmakers on June 1, 2023.

title: Major Alabama bill cutting sales tax on groceries wins final passage
description: The Alabama Legislature has given final passage to a major bill that would cut grocery sales tax from 4% to 2%, following decades of unsuccessful attempts to pass similar measures.

title: Son of Home Depot worker assaulted by shoplifter pleads for action on retail crime: 'Has to be consequences'
description: The son of a Home Depot employee fatally assaulted by a shoplifter demanded "consequences" for retail theft during a recent interview, amid a surge in such crimes.

title: First lady Jill Biden arrives in Egypt to promote empowerment for women, education for young people
description: Jill Biden has been traveling across the Middle East, Africa, and Europe to promote education for young people and empowerment for women. Biden arrived in Cairo on June 2, 2023.

title: UN warns cyclone-hit areas of Burma aren't receiving nearly enough aid, could face major food crisis soon
description: Cyclone-hit areas of Burma aren't receiving nearly enough aid, according to the United Nations. The organization fears the country may face a major food crisis soon.

title: Crime is surging and here’s a way to help stop it
description: Crime is surging and here’s a way to help stop it. Worst inflation in more than 40 years is tied directly to spike in crime – even the New York Times admits it.

title: California city faces fury of residents at community meeting: Who wants to live like this?!
description: Oakland business owners Adam Stemmler and Henry Wimmer highlight their frustration with the city's crime problem following Tuesday's city meeting.

title: Al Pacino's 29-year-old girlfriend: Who is Noor Alfallah?
description: Al Pacino is about to be the oldest father in Hollywood. Here is what to know about his 29-year-old girlfriend, Noor Alfallah, who is pregnant with the 83-year-old actor's fourth child.

title: Nuggets' Nikola Jokic makes history in NBA Finals debut
description: Denver Nuggets center Nikola Jokic made NBA history on Thursday in Game 1 of the NBA Finals, recording a triple-double in his finals debut.

title: Tesla treasure trove found in China after 13 years now worth a record $2 million
description: A bidder has offered $2 million for three new 2010 Tesla Roadsters that were discovered in shipping containers in China, where they had been for 13 years.

title: Immigrant store owner begs San Francisco for help after losing $100K to burglars: 'Worse than Afghanistan'
description: A San Francisco business owner says he may have to leave the city after a group of thieves smashed the window of his store and made off with over $100,000 of merchandise.

title: US Army’s Fort Bragg in North Carolina strips its Confederate name in ceremony
description: Motivated by the 2020 George Floyd protests, military installation Fort Bragg in North Carolina is stripping its Confederate name to become Fort Liberty in a ceremony Friday.

title: Gov. Noem will send 50 National Guard troops to southern border ‘warzone’ to help Texas
description: Kristi Noem, South Dakota's Republican governor, says she will send 50 National Guard troops to the southern border to assist Gov. Greg Abbott's efforts.

title: Oregon Democrats plan to start fining GOP senators as boycott hits 1-month mark
description: Democrats in Oregon have voted to fine Republican senators $325, an amount that reflects lawmakers' average daily pay, for every absence that denies the chamber a quorum.

title: Louisiana Republicans resurrect bill banning gender surgery for minors
description: Lawmakers in Louisiana resurrected a bill aimed at banning gender surgeries for minors after it was narrowly killed by state legislatures last week.

title: High temperatures in parts of Great Lakes region force schools to close, students to shift to remote learning
description: High temperatures in the Great Lakes region have forced schools to close in some areas. A Michigan Superintendent claimed the temperatures raised a safety concern.

title: Nevada Republican Party sues state to maintain party-run caucuses
description: The GOP in Nevada is suing the state to maintain its party-run caucuses. The state's lawmakers ditched the presidential caucuses model after the 2020 election.

title: Nebraska lawmakers adjourn for year after banning gender surgery for minors, abortion
description: After nearly every bill brought before Nebraska lawmakers was filibustered during a particularly contentious session, the state's lawmakers adjourned for the year on June 1, 2023.

title: Olympic medalist Bode Miller shares video of son running uphill after 'quitting on his soccer team'
description: Six-time Olympic medalist Bode Miller shared a parenting moment on social media last week after he said his son quit during his first soccer game of the year.

title: Pair of falcons terrorize busy Chicago street to protect their offspring
description: Multiple Chicago walkers have been attacked by a pair of falcons along Wacker Drive. The falcons are raising their offspring and attacking people walking below their nest.

title: European course will not host Open Championship while affiliated with Donald Trump: report
description: As long as Donald Trump is associated with Trump Turnberry golf resort in Scotland, the R&A said they will never choose the course for The Open Championship.

title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein, chaotic aftermath at the New York City prison is illuminated in new records: report
description: New records have reportedly revealed fresh insight into the circumstances surrounding the 2019 death of disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, as well as the aftermath.

title: Hunter Biden arming himself with Second Amendment defense amid DOJ probe for illegal gun purchase: report
description: Hunter Biden could soon find himself embracing the Second Amendment in an attempt to defend against possible charges for possessing a firearm as a drug user.

title: Actor Ken Jeong jeered for brutal halfcourt shots during Game 1 of Nuggets-Heat NBA Finals
description: "The Hangover" star Ken Jeong was seen at halfcourt during Game 1 of the NBA Finals between the Nuggets and Heat attempting to make a shot, but it did not go as planned.

title: Blaming banks for the environment is not good business
description: The future for many banks is inextricably tied to their policies and practices on climate, energy and the environment. And that portends more risk than reward.

title: Manhunt on for suspect who shot 2-year-old boy, older family member, police say
description: Indiana police are searching for 35-year-old Robbie L. Perez of Columbus, who is suspected of shooting two people including a 2-year-old boy and relative.

title: Nevada Gov. Joe Lombardo vetoes measure criminalizing fake electors
description: Joe Lombardo, the governor of Nevada, has rejected legislation that would have criminalized falsely stating that a losing candidate won a certain state.

title: Biden critics accused of 'pouncing on' president's fall at Air Force Academy: 'Talking point for Republicans'
description: While reporting on President Biden falling at the Air Force Academy commencement on Thursday, some media outlets accused Republicans of "pouncing" on the incident.

title: New Mexico's AG sues manufacturers of ‘forever chemicals’
description: The attorney general of New Mexico and the state’s Environment Department has filed a lawsuit against 21 companies that produced or distributed forever chemicals.

title: US lawyer Kimberly West appointed chief prosecutor at office linked to European Union war crimes court
description: Kimberly West, an American lawyer, will serve as the chief prosecutor in the Specialist Prosecutor's Office in Kosovo. She currently works for a Boston law firm.

title: Steve Garvey, 10-time MLB All-Star, considering US Senate bid in California
description: Steve Garvey, a 10-time All-Star, 1974 NL MVP, and 1981 World Series champion, is considering running for the United States Senate in 2024.

title: Nick Saban headlines SEC contingent headed to Washington DC to vouch for NIL regulation
description: Alabama head football coach Nick Saban and SEC commissioner Greg Sankey will be headed to Washington, D.C., next week in efforts to regulate NIL.

title: Ohio Republican lawmakers push for revised school voucher program
description: A revised school voucher program being pushed by Republicans in Ohio would give taxpayers money to send kids to private and religious schools, or fund homeschooling.

title: NASA to send original work by US Poet Ada Limón to Jupiter's moon Europa
description: Famous U.S. Poet Ada Limon wrote a poem in honor of NASA's upcoming mission to Jupiter's moon. The poem is called “In Praise of Mystery: A Poem for Europa."

title: Rosalynn Carter diagnosed with dementia at 95: What to know about the condition in the ‘oldest old’
description: Rosalynn Carter, 95, wife of former President Jimmy Carter, has been diagnosed with dementia. Diagnosis and risk factors are very different for people in their 90s, a doctor explains.

title: How DNA identified Australian family man as escaped US fugitive who murdered his parents
description: DNA evidence confirms that a dead Australian family man was a U.S. fugitive who fatally shot his parents in Omaha, Nebraska, in 1958, in a dispute over their car.

title: Border Patrol medical staff didn’t review 8-year-old migrant’s health conditions before her death: 'Upsetting'
description: An internal investigation by the U.S. Customs and Border Protection after the death of an 8-year-old migrant revealed contracted medical staff did not review the child’s health history.

title: Catholic theologian blasts LA Dodgers for honoring fake drag queen nuns: 'Absolutely offensive'
description: Theologian and former Catholic priest Jonathan Morris calls out the Los Angeles Dodgers for honoring a drag queen group that mocks the Catholic faith on "The Story."

title: Often divided Supreme Court shows unity in protecting this fundamental right
description: Even with a Supreme Court sharply divided over questions of race, religion and government power, the justices came together to re-affirm the most basic of constitutional freedoms.

title: DC library plans Children's Pride Parade for 'all kids 0-18': 'We want this to be an event for every family'
description: The Daily Signal obtained fliers from the DC Public Library that revealed plans for an upcoming LGBTQ pride parade on Saturday that will target children and minors under 18.

description: Several Twitter users were shocked and disgusted at the recent video of President Biden falling onto the floor after giving a speech at the U.S. Air Force Academy.

title: Pride month: Local governments host Drag Queen Story Hour events across country
description: Dozens of government-sponsored drag queen events for children as young as 3 are sweeping the country as Pride Month kicks off.

title: California activist crowdfunding his move out of San Francisco’s ‘zombie apocalypse’
description: A conservative activist who documents San Francisco's fentanyl crisis is now trying to crowdfund his way out of the city's infamous Tenderloin neighborhood. Here's why.

description: Christie Krause speaks out about the death of her friend, Becky Bliefnick, who was murdered by her estranged husband, Timothy, three years after 'Family Feud' appearance.

title: 'Charlie's Angels' star Farrah Fawcett was 'a fighter' during cancer battle, pal says: 'She wanted to live'
description: Farrah Fawcett, the '70s poster girl who starred as Jill Munroe in "Charlie's Angels," passed away in 2009 at age 62 following a lengthy battle with anal cancer.

title: China wants to be energy superpower. Here’s how they can be stopped
description: China wants to be global energy superpower. Here’s how President XI’s ambitions can be stopped. Chinese already dominate energy transition from fossil fuels.

description: Target staffers are questioning if they "belong" after a disastrous rollout of Pride month left workers on both sides of the issue peeved, according to an insider.

title: Wyoming woman accused of setting fire to state's only full-service abortion clinic entering plea
description: Lorna Roxanne Green, 22, will enter a plea to an arson charge in federal court on Friday, just over a year after she allegedly set fire to Wyoming's only full-service abortion clinic.

title: Meet the American who 'won the war for us': Andrew Jackson Higgins, World War II New Orleans boatbuilder
description: Andrew Jackson Higgins, native of Nebraska, designed and built in New Orleans he famous amphibious landing craft used by the US and Allies to fight and win World War II.

title: The VW Microbus is back: Electric Volkswagen ID. Buzz van revealed for USA
description: The U.S.-market ID. Buzz electric minivan has been revealed with three rows of seating and the choice of a rear-wheel-drive or all-wheel-drive powertrain.

title: 'Should be concerned': Congress opens up on new threats posed to US labor market
description: Congress knows artificial Intelligence will impact American jobs, but what should lawmakers do about it? They're not entirely sure, but they are concerned.

description: Country musicians including Tyler Hubbard and Nate Smith are sounding the alarm on AI, and RIAA Chairman Mitch Glazier talks about taking legal action against fake music and bots.

title: Confess your sins: Clergy call on government to admit COVID church crackdowns were unlawful, harmful
description: A group of Christian New Zealand pastors are pursuing legal recognition that their government's crackdown on churches during the COVID-19 pandemic was unlawful and damaging.

title: Crown Prince Hussein of Jordan's royal wedding: Prince William, Kate Middleton join VIPs at lavish ceremony
description: Rajwa Alseif, now a princess, wore a wedding gown by Lebanese designer Elie Saab. She arrived at Zahran Palace in a 1968 Rolls-Royce Phantom V custom-made for the ceremony.

title: Congress races to research AI-enhanced drones to maintain national security edge over China
description: Legislation moving through the House would provide millions of dollars for research on how to incorporate artificial intelligence into drone technology to keep pace with China.

title: How AI will revolutionize politics in 2024, and why voters must be vigilant
description: What we’re about to see in the 2024 election cycle, with the introduction of artificial intelligence, is the rise of "performance-enhancing digital."

title: AI identified these 5 types of heart failure in new study: 'Interesting to differentiate'
description: University College London researchers used machine learning — a type of artificial intelligence — to pinpoint five types of heart failure, with a goal of predicting the prognosis for them.

title: US ally reportedly calls Biden foreign policy in Kosovo 'naive' amid rising tensions with Serbia
description: Kosovo's prime minister fired back at U.S. criticism in an interview last week after violence in northern Kosovo. Several NATO peacekeepers were injured during violent protests.

title: Robots could go full 'Terminator' after scientists create realistic, self-healing skin
description: Stanford University researchers developed life-like skin for robots, similar the cyborg featured in the "Terminator," that can be punctured and heal itself.

title: Bureaucrats shouldn't impose global AI policy at 'fancy, high-level' meetings, expert warns
description: The U.S. already aligned roughly 50 countries, including Russia and China, behind an artificial intelligence development principles agreement in 2019 under the OECD.

title: NBA Finals: Nikola Jokic, Jamal Murray lead Nuggets to dominant win over Heat in Game 1
description: The Denver Nuggets set the tone for the NBA Finals, dominating the Miami Heat in Game 1 to take an early lead in the series. It was the first Finals game played in Nuggets history

title: Florida teen Dev Shah wins Scripps National Spelling Bee after third attempt at trophy
description: Dev Shah, a 14-year-old eighth-grade student from Largo, Florida, won the 2023 Scripps National Spelling Bee trophy on June 1 after correctly spelling "psammophile."

title: GREG GUTFELD: Blue Jays' Anthony Bass' apology is a hot, steaming pile of crap
description: Fox News host Greg Gutfeld blasted Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Anthony Bass for apologizing for his statement on his Christian beliefs on "Gutfeld!"

title: On this day in history, June 2, 1953, Queen Elizabeth II is coronated at London's Westminster Abbey
description: Queen Elizabeth II — on this day in history, June 2, 1953 — is crowned monarch of the U.K. before guests, dignitaries and royals at Westminster Abbey. She became the longest reigning monarch.
